intro: Pelaphia, commonly known as the rock pear, is a small shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes other citrus-like plants. Pelaphia is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystems.
